questions.text: Krüppel-like factor-2 (KLF2) is associated with Dilated
questions.correct_answer: C. Atherosclerosis

questions.text: 25-year-old male with history of smoking from past 11 years came with findings given below. Which of the following will be incorrect statement about this disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: Earliest manifestation will be cold induced Ravnaud's phenomenon.

options.label: B
options.text: Segmental thrombosis will be involving vein, artery, and nerves.

options.label: D
options.text: Intermittent claudication is never seen in these patients

questions.correct_answer: D. Intermittent claudication is never seen in these patients

questions.text: A 38-year-old male patient presented with severe dyspnea . On echocardiography, it was showing mitral stenosis with left atrium hypertrophy. Histopathology of vegetations from mitral, valve is seen as given in below Image. All of the following statements are true about this condition, except:

options.label: B
options.text: Caterpillar like nuclear chromatin is seen in Anitschkow cells.

options.label: D
options.text: Fish mouth mitral stenosis is due to fibrosis and calcification.

questions.correct_answer: C. Aschoff's giant cell is diagnostic.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male suffers from congestive heart failure and died suddenly. He has no history of drug abuse, valvular disease, or systemic disorder. Myocardial histopathology is shown in the given image. These morphologic features are most consistent with which mutation?

options.label: D
options.text: Beta- MHC (Myosin Heavy Chain gene mutation

questions.correct_answer: D. Beta- MHC (Myosin Heavy Chain gene mutation

questions.text: Based on below given images most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.correct_answer: C. Naxos syndrome

questions.text: In Lobar pneumonia, the presence of fibrinosuppurative exudate with disintegration of red cells is seen in the tsage of
questions.correct_answer: D. Resolution.

questions.text: A patient with obstructive pulmonary disorder was examined cytologically and finding is shown below. Which of the following is true about this image?

options.label: A
options.text: Its a Curschmann spiralis containing mucous plug

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with type IlI Hypersensitivity reactions

questions.correct_answer: C. Galectin-10 is a component

questions.text: Asbestosis of the lung is associated with all of the following except:

options.label: B
options.text: Progression of lesion even after stopping exposure to asbestos.

options.label: C
options.text: Nodular lesions initially involves upper lobe

options.label: D
options.text: Adenocarcinoma is most common cancer associated with asbestosis.

questions.correct_answer: C. Nodular lesions initially involves upper lobe

questions.text: 45-year-old male, an asbestos factory worker has presented with lung mass. Ultrastructural examination has revealed findings which are shown in image. Most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.correct_answer: B. Mesothelioma

questions.text: A 45-year-old smoker presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied. Histopathology is shown in given Image. Which of the following will be true about this?
questions.correct_answer: D. Chromogranin-A positive.

questions.text: A 42-year-old smoker male presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied.H istopathology is shown in given Image. Which of the following is not true about this?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common paraneoplastic syndrome associated is Hypercalcemia

options.label: B
options.text: It will be positive for neurofilament.

options.label: C
options.text: Salt and pepper like nuclear chromatin.

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with Azzopardi effect.

questions.correct_answer: A. Most common paraneoplastic syndrome associated is Hypercalcemia

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl is presenting with cola coloured urine. on physical examination her blood pressure was 154/100 mmHg. Renal biopsy was performed and electron microscopy was showing the features shown in below given image. Most likely diagnosis in this case will be?
questions.correct_answer: D. Acute proliferative glomerulonephritis

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about RPGN?

options.label: A
options.text: Semilunar structures consists of Parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and monocytes.

options.label: B
options.text: Most important factor in crescent formation is Fibrin.

options.label: C
options.text: Crescents are not characteristic finding of RPGN

options.label: D
options.text: Rupture of basement membrane is seen.

questions.correct_answer: C. Crescents are not characteristic finding of RPGN

questions.text: Renal biopsy from a hematuria patient is given below. Which of the following is true about this Condition:

options.label: C
options.text: Most commonly associated with Membranous nephropathy.

options.label: D
options.text: Most commonly associated with Diffuse proliferative glomerulopathy

questions.correct_answer: D. Most commonly associated with Diffuse proliferative glomerulopathy

questions.text: A 55 years old male presenting with periorbital edema, facial puffiness and massive proteinuria. Renal biopsy has revealed following features under Direct Immunofluorescence (DIF) and electron microscopy (EM) as shown in given picture. All of the following are true regarding this condition except:

options.label: A
options.text: Circulating antibodies to PLA2R will correlate prognosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Basement membrane Rupture will be seen

questions.correct_answer: D. Basement membrane Rupture will be seen

questions.text: A patient with BP of 190/120 died and autopsy has shown findings given in image. Which of the following is not true about this condition:

options.label: D
options.text: Hyaline arteriolosclerosis will be seen on LM

questions.correct_answer: D. Hyaline arteriolosclerosis will be seen on LM

questions.text: Renal mass was resected and following histopathology was seen. All of the following statements are true regarding this tumour, except:

options.label: C
options.text: Vacuoles contain both glycogen and lipid.

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of chromosome 1,2, 6,7, and 10.

questions.text: Histopathology of a 9 year old boy with brain tumour is shown below. Most likely it is ?
questions.correct_answer: A. GFAP

questions.text: A 60 -year-old man presents with a 2-week history of tonic-clonic seizures that initially involve his left arm but have more recently progressed to involve his left leg. The seizures are accompanied by muscle weakness but no other eurologic signs. A CT scan reveals a mass in the left cerebral hemisphere.A left frontoparietal craniotomy is performed. Histologic examination of the brain biopsy is shown in the image. Which of the following is not true about this tumour?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common Primary Malignant brain tumor in adults.

options.label: B
options.text: Most common site is frontal lobe.

options.label: D
options.text: True Palisading pattern of tumour cells are seen

questions.correct_answer: D. True Palisading pattern of tumour cells are seen

questions.text: A 10-year-old patient with brain tumour came, and biopsy was taken and shown below in image. Which of the following is false :

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with SHH gene mutation

options.label: B
options.text: It is associated with n-MYC amplification.

options.label: D
options.text: It will be showing rossestes without neuropil

questions.correct_answer: D. It will be showing rossestes without neuropil

questions.text: Histopathology of a Patient with retrobulbar mass is shown below. Which of the following is not true?

options.label: B
options.text: Most commonly arise from inferior vestibular branch of 8th cranial nerve.

options.label: C
options.text: Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni A areas.

options.label: D
options.text: Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni B areas

questions.correct_answer: D. Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni B areas

questions.text: A 45-year-old female was analysed for heartburn history from past 2 months.He also give history of food allergies. Endoscopy, double contrast esophagogram, and biopsy finding is shown below. Which of the following is incorrect about this condition

options.label: A
options.text: It is also known as feline esophagus.

options.label: B
options.text: It is also known as Allergic esophagitis.

options.label: C
options.text: Eosinophilic inflammation may be seen in other organs also.

questions.correct_answer: B. It is also known as Allergic esophagitis.

questions.text: All of the following are true about celiac disease, except

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in thickness of the mucosa

questions.correct_answer: B. Decrease in thickness of the mucosa

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy was having abdominal pain and malena from past two years. His clinical and radiological examination has revealed the findings consistent with intussusception. Histopathology of lesion is shown below in given image. Which of the following is most likely to be associated with this condition:

options.label: D
options.text: Mutations of the APC gene (Adenomatous Polyposis Coli)

questions.correct_answer: C. Mutation in the STK11 gene

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presenting with nausea, upper abdominal pain, and jaundice following a heavy bout of drinking in a celebration party. Physical examination was eliciting right upper quadrant tenderness. A liver biopsy is obtained, and the microscopic appearance is shown in the figure. What is the nature of the accumulations seen in the biopsy?
questions.correct_answer: D. Cytokeratin 8.

questions.text: A 23-year-old male with chronic liver disease was evaluated and found to be having findings given below. This condition is most likely to be associated with which of the following alterations?
questions.correct_answer: B. Risk for Parkinson's disease.

questions.text: A 50-year-old female presenting with right breast lump from past 9 months. She also complaints about headaches associated with nausea for the past 2 months. An H and E stained section is shown in the figure. Which of the following is incorrect about this breast tumour?

options.label: A
options.text: Multifocal and bilateral metastases is common.

options.label: B
options.text: Dyscohesive tumour cells will be seen.

options.label: C
options.text: Associated with SNAIL and TWIST gene mutation.

questions.correct_answer: D. Overexpréssion of E-Cadherin gene

questions.text: A 57-year-old female presented with breast mass. Gross and hostopathology shown below. Which of the following is not true regarding this tumour?

options.label: D
options.text: MC breast ca on histology is Invasive Ductal CA

questions.correct_answer: C. Cancer cells block dermal lymphatics

questions.text: A 43-year-old-female with breast cancer was showing Luminal Type C. Which of the following is true regarding this cancer?

options.label: C
options.text: Luminal A type, BRCA2 positive, good prognosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Luminal B type, BRCA 2 positive, bad prognosis.

questions.correct_answer: A. Her 2 positive, bad prognosis,Trastuzumab sensitive

questions.text: A 43-year-old male came with complains of a vague feeling of painless heaviness in the left scrotum from past 10 months. Testicular mass was resected, gross and histopathology findings are shown below in given image. which of the following is true

options.label: A
options.text: Oct3 and oct 4 are molecular markers

options.label: B
options.text: Beta- HCG is a tumour marker.

options.label: D
options.text: No glandular pattern seen on microscopy.

questions.correct_answer: B. Beta- HCG is a tumour marker.

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy was noticed to be having left testicular mass by his parents. An orchiectomy was performed, and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following is not true about this tumor?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common testicular tumor in pubertal age group

questions.correct_answer: A. Most common testicular tumor in pubertal age group

questions.text: A 23-year-old boy was noticed to be having testicular mass • An orchiectomy was performed, Gross and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following tumor marker will be seen in this tumor?
questions.correct_answer: C. LDH

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presented with anterior neck swelling. During childhood she was exposed to radiation. Histopathology of swelling is shown in image. All of the following are true about this condition except ?
questions.correct_answer: C. Shows hematogenous spread.

questions.text: 55 years old man is presenting with blurring of vision and massive proteinuria. Fundus examination of eye has revealed cotton wool spots, and dot and blot hemorrhage. Renal biopsy was done for evaluation and is shown below. Most Likely diagnosis is:
questions.correct_answer: D. Kimmelstiel-Wilson Disease

questions.text: Breast biopsy with immunohistochemical staining for ER, PR and Her2/neu is shown to be triple negative. Which of the following is true statement?

options.label: C
options.text: Worst prognosis with hormonal therapy responsive cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Worst prognosis without hormonal therapy resistant cancer

questions.correct_answer: D. Worst prognosis without hormonal therapy resistant cancer

questions.text: A 28-year-old sexually active female presented with dyspareunia followed by vaginal bleeding showing red, friable, nodular mass on the anterior wall of vagina. Histopathology of lesion is shown in the image. Which of the following conditions is likely to have contributed most to the origin of this neoplasm?
questions.correct_answer: B. Diethylstilbestrol (DES) exposure

questions.text: A 28-year-old man has had increasing shortness of breath and breath sounds are decreased in all lung fields. He has family history of liver disease and he had developed marked icterus as a neonate. His liver biopsy stained with PAS shows histopathology given in image. This patient is having high risk for development of which of the following conditions?
questions.correct_answer: C. Pulmonary emphysema

questions.text: LIVER biopsy showing characteristic cells shown in image. Most Likely diagnosis will be:

options.label: B
options.text: Ground glass hepatocytes of hepatitis-B virus

questions.correct_answer: B. Ground glass hepatocytes of hepatitis-B virus

questions.text: A 51 yr old male presents with symptoms that developed following a long weekend of binge drinking. His serum reveals GGT level of 65 IU/L A liver biopsy reveals fatty change (steatosis) of numerous hepatocytes. This patient's liver abnormality is most likely the result of.

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased free fatty acid delivery to liver

options.label: C
options.text: Increased mitochondrial oxidation of fatty acids

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased NADH production

questions.text: All of the following are true about Peutz-jeghers syndrome, except:
questions.correct_answer: C. Autosomal recessive

questions.text: A 39-year-old woman has had episodes of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea for 2to 3 years. Recently, the episodes became increasingly common, and she noted a weight loss of about 8 pounds. She tells you that one of her uncle have had similar symptoms for years" and Recently one of them had colon cancer. On Examination, there are no abdominal masses and no fistulas. The most likely findings on colonoscopy with biopsy are:

options.label: B
options.text: Patchy inflammatory lesions that extend throughout the bowel wall

options.label: D
options.text: Continuous inflammatory changes mostly confined to the mucosa

questions.correct_answer: D. Continuous inflammatory changes mostly confined to the mucosa

questions.text: Which of the following is correct A. For Serological diagnosis of PSGN, anti-DNAase antibody is better than ASO Ab B. Most common pattern of inheritence in ALPORT syndrome is XLD. C. Crescents are made up of parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and Leucocytes D. On immunofluorescence of Goodpasture syndrome, granular deposits (IgG and C3) are seen.

options.label: D
options.text: All four (A, B, C, & D) are correct.

questions.correct_answer: A. A, B, C are correct

questions.text: A 18-Year-old male presents with hematuria. Urinalysis shows , no ketones, no glucose, 1+ blood, and no leukocytes. A renal biopsy reveals tubular epithellal foam cells by Light microscopy. By electron microscopy the glomerular basement membrane shows areas of attenuation, with splitting and lamination of lamina dense in other thickened areas. The most probable diagnosis is-
questions.correct_answer: D. Alport's syndrome

questions.text: 41 year-old man presented with painless hematuria. Bimanual Examination revealed a mass over the right flank. Subsequently right nephrectomy was done and the mass was seen to be composed of cells with clear cytoplasm. Cytogenetic analysis of this mass is likely to reveal the abnormality of-
questions.correct_answer: B. Chromosome 3

questions.text: Most common finding of lung in COVID 19 infection is:
questions.correct_answer: A. Alveolar Damage

questions.text: At the time of autopsy of a 49-year-old female who had malar rash, several medium sized vegetations are found on both sides of the mitral valve and tricuspid valve. These cardiac vegetations are most likely the result of -

options.label: A
options.text: Turbulent blood flow through an incompetent mitral valve

options.label: B
options.text: Bacterial colonization of an abnormal valve

options.label: D
options.text: Cachexia produced by a hypercoagulable state

questions.correct_answer: C. Presence of an anticardiolipin antibody

questions.text: 35-year-old male smoker presents with gangrene of his extremities. Which one of the following histologic findings from a biopsy of the blood vessels supplying this area would be most suggestive of the diagnosis of Buerger's disease?
questions.correct_answer: D. Thrombosis with microabscesses

questions.text: Histopathology section shows this image from a patent who died of Myocardial infarction. This change will be seen occur after
questions.correct_answer: A. 1 to 3 days

questions.text: A patient of AIDS presents with multiple, purple colored skin nodules on his hands and feet. Biopsy of skin lesion is shown in the image. Which of the following is implicated in pathogenesis of this disorder?
questions.correct_answer: C. Human herpesvirus-8

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl who is normally developed has chronic progressive exercise intolerance. On physical Examination, temperature is 37.1°C, pulse is 70/min, respirations are 14/min, and blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg. A chest radiograph shows cardiomegaly and mild pulmonary edema. An echocardiogram shows severe left ventricular hypertrophy and a prominent interventricular septum. The right ventricle is slightly thickened. The ejection fraction is abnormally high, and the ventricular volume and cardiac output are both low. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the cardiac abnormalities in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Mutations in B-myosin heavy chain
